cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest and north mid-week, pulling away from the northern Leeward Islands toward the open western Atlantic and in the general direction of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Passage near Barbuda/Antigua (no major landfall expected on larger landmasses)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands with swells affecting the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico Atlantic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (â‰¤3% chance); isolated squalls with gusts below gale force possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional heavy showers possible, but totals generally expected to stay below 2 inches for St. Croix.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north and east-facing beaches through mid-week
